intro: Ancistrophyllum, commonly known as the mountain sage or desert sage, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plants typically have aromatic, glandular leaves and produce small, tubular flowers that are often purple or blue in color. Ancistrophyllum species are shrubs or subshrubs with woody stems and are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and traditional uses in herbal medicine.
